pullRequest.title: Fixed modded overworld biomes not spawning [1.16.x]
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adapted the same patch on 1.15.2 to 1.16.1 Forge to allow modded forge biomes from BiomeManager to be used in BiomeLayer with weighted lists. Should be straight forward and crucial patch, of course let me know if there are changes required to the styling or similar.
PR will allow modded biomes to spawn in the overworld.  Test mod modded_overworld_biomes_test included, adding the biome red_biome with bright red grass so it can be found easily.

commit.message: Added support for modded forge biomes to the overworld through BiomeLayer

nodes.bodyText: Is there a reason these fields are being deleted rather than just no longer using them?

There is no reason to be changing the formatting of vanilla classes (such as moving the bracket to the next line). And the formatting should match the rest of the file, which means that for patches brackets go on the same line not on the next one (there are a lot of cases below where you are putting them on the next one).
I am not actually positive on the stance of Forge Registry vs Vanilla Registry use in patches, but is there a reason this is using the vanilla registry instead of the Forge Registry for biomes?

commit.message: Fixed formatting and fingers crossed fixed the hunk target errors

nodes.bodyText: Not sure if extra whitespace in a patch is a problem or not, since forge prefers patches to be as small as possible. But it's probably fine.

commit.message: Cleaned useless vanilla biome check in `getWeightedBiomeEntry`

Revert "Cleaned useless vanilla biome check in `getWeightedBiomeEntry`"

This reverts commit d7e07d68e5e56f3b2556149f802a4eebc1470b01.

nodes.bodyText: You need to add the Forge method markers. Additionally please check that this is at the end of the file.

You could probably get rid of this line as well.
Just use type.ordinal() in the couple of places you are using it.

Are these original fields still in use?
If not: Put a  @Deprecated in front of them (on the same line) and a comment behind them referencing their replacement (also on the same line)
Eventhough these fields might be private, if vanilla code becomes unused by forge changes. We should keep track of this. Not just for people using the code, but also for porters who port the patch in the future. It is then always good to know what happens with a field.
Do not remove the field since that can also cause issue. As I said a @Deprecated and a comment should suffice.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+--- a/net/minecraft/world/gen/layer/BiomeLayer.java
++++ b/net/minecraft/world/gen/layer/BiomeLayer.java
+@@ -28,12 +28,32 @@
+    private static final int[] field_202746_t = new int[]{field_202730_d, field_202729_c, field_202741_o, field_202736_j};

nodes.bodyText:
Please remove this whiteline.
It is not needed.

commit.message: Moved `getWeightedBiomeEntry` to `BiomeManager`, can be reverted if needed.

nodes.bodyText: This method can probably be renamed to getWeightedBiome and just return the Biome, since the weight value is only needed here and not in BiomeLayer.
Please add a comment stating why they are deprecated and what their replacement is, if any.

@Xerousso You can leave it like this.
It does not hurt to have it return BiomeEntry instead of biome.
See the other mods on how todo these. Most notably missing is a way to disable a given testmod.
